issues.description: The problem statement’s UML and text define the abstract method messageOnFeed() to return a String, but in the solution repository Animal.java declares messageOnFeed() to return FeedResponse. Students following the spec will implement String-returning methods, yet the solution’s use of FeedResponse diverges from both the UML and the intended template design.
issues.suggested_fix: Change the return type of Animal.messageOnFeed() in the solution (and all overrides) back to String, removing or refactoring FeedResponse so that messageOnFeed() returns the String directly as specified.

issues.description: Within the solution repository itself, Animal.messageOnFeed() is declared to return FeedResponse, but Goat.java overrides messageOnFeed() returning a plain String. This return-type mismatch prevents the code from compiling and contradicts the abstract method signature.
issues.suggested_fix: Make Goat.messageOnFeed() return a FeedResponse (or change Animal to return String uniformly) so that the override’s return type matches the abstract method signature.
